definition: making up a group, forming a troupe (idiom); in large numbers/as a large crowd
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng
group/crowd/flock, herd, pack etc
variant of 群[qun2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
squadron/team/group/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Of course there are still some certain group-forming tendencies.
sentences.chinese: 当然，它们仍然有某些成群结队的倾向。

sentences.english: Health in the central part of the island to a famous temple monkeys, and monkeys in droves.
sentences.chinese: 在岛中部的生宜有著名的猴子庙，猴子成群结队。

sentences.english: People are thronging to see his new play .
sentences.chinese: 人们成群结队地去看他那出新戏。

sentences.english: The spectators trooped out of the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 观众成群结队地走出体育场。

sentences.english: Kin-folk come to see Yvonne by the dozen.
sentences.chinese: 亲友们成群结队来看伊娃挤得水泄不通。

sentences.english: From all over the pond, they came swimming by dozens.
sentences.chinese: 从池塘的各个角落，它们成群结队的游过来。

sentences.english: But visitors should beware of pickpockets who often work in teams.
sentences.chinese: 但游客要小心那里成群结队的小偷。

sentences.english: This summer, people flocked to the swimming pool to keep cool during the heat wave.
sentences.chinese: 今年夏天，人们成群结队来到泳池纳凉，躲避热浪。

sentences.english: Crowds of young demonstrators protested against the increase in students' fees.
sentences.chinese: 成群结队的年轻示威者们抗议增加学费。

sentences.english: Groups of spotted eagle rays cruise around the pinnacles.
sentences.chinese: 斑点鹰𫚉成群结队在石笋周围漫游。

sentences.english: Vistors came in flocks to see the new bridge.
sentences.chinese: 参观者成群结队地来观看这座新桥。

sentences.english: Sometimes you know, people, they come in big waves.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，人们成群结队地来到这里。
矿工们成群结队地回家了。

sentences.english: Kin-folk come to see Yvonne, by the dozen.
sentences.chinese: 亲友们成群结队来看依凡，把这儿挤得水泄不通。

sentences.english: Wild geese herd to the south in autumn every year.
sentences.chinese: 每年秋天大雁都成群结队地飞往南方。

sentences.english: People came trooping out of the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 人们成群结队地走出戏院。

definition: in groups/large numbers of/grouping
to troop (of soldiers etc)/convoy
in groups of three or four (idiom)
in twos and threes
to flock (to see)/to mill/to throng
to come and go/to roam about (mostly unseen)/(of a ghost) to haunt (a place)/(of a criminal) to stalk (the streets)/(of the sun) to rise and set
to forage/to hunt for food/to scavenge/fig. to make a living
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
hundreds/a large number/lit. by the hundreds and thousands
lit. covering the mountains and the plains (idiom)/fig. as far as the eye can see/covering everything/omnipresent
to drive (vehicle)/to drive out/to chase away/to herd (people towards a gate)
supporting a wife and children/dragged down by having a family to feed
to scatter in all directions
dragged down by having a family to feed
to frolic/to romp
taking everyone along, young and old/to look after the elderly and the young
